frameDefinitions: In this frame an Evaluee is judged by a (usually implicit)
In this frame, a Resource_controller is judged by a Judge (who is usually implicit)  according to how freely they allow the Recipient access to their Resource.
An Agent performs an Action incorrectly.
An Experiencer senses different degrees of warmth that may or may not be related to the ambient temperature.
The words of this frame describe how a Resource_controller spends money or other Resources for a particular purpose .
A Donor transfers a Theme from a Donor to a Recipient.
frameExamples: It was <t>nice</t> of you to send a card.
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Evaluee</fen> is the person whose <fen>Behavior</fen> towards other human beings is being evaluated.
The <fen>Affected_party</fen> is the entity which is positively or negatively treated by the <fen>Evaluee</fen>.
The <fen>Behavior</fen> is the action of the <fen>Evaluee</fen> on which the evaluation of the <fen>Evaluee</fen>'s character is based.
The <fen>Topic</fen> is the situation or person that the <fen>Evaluee</fen>'s <fen>Behavior</fen> responds to or is related to.
The <fen>Expressor</fen> is the body part or action by a body part which indicates the character of the <fen>Evaluee</fen>.
The individual whose point of view is taken in assigning the evaluation denoted by the target.
The Resource_Controller is the individual who controls access to the Resource.
The Resource_controller controls the Recipient's access to the Resource.
The <fen>Recipient</fen> is the individual or individuals who receive or should receive the <fen>Resource</fen> from the <fen>Resource_controller</fen>.
The Behavior is an action of the Resource_controller which is judged to be generous or stingy.
The <fen>Expressor</fen> is the body part or action by a body part which indicates the character of the <fen>Resource_controller</fen>.
The <fen>Agent</fen> performs an action incorrectly.
<fen>Patient</fen> is the entity affected by the <fen>Agent</fen>'s bungling of an <fen>Action</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Action</fen> that the <fen>Agent</fen> performs incorrectly.
The type of action that the <fen>Agent</fen> habitually bungles.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the bungling occurs.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the bungling occurs.
The entity which perceives a level of warmth.
A part of the body of the <fen>Experiencer</fen> in which the sensation of a temperature is located.

The <fen>Resource_controller</fen> is the individual whose frugality or generosity is being described. Person typically occurs as the External Argument or, in some cases when <fen>Behavior</fen> is also expressed, in an <ment>of</ment>-PP:
Some specific <fen>Behavior</fen> may be described as frugal or extravagant, rather than attributing the characteristic directly to the <fen>Resource_controller</fen>.
This role is the resource which the <fen>Resource_controller</fen> expends.
The person that begins in possession of the <fen>Theme</fen> and causes it to be in the possession of the <fen>Recipient</fen> .
The entity that ends up in possession of the <fen>Theme</fen>.
The object that changes ownership.
The <fen>Time</fen> is when the <fen>Donor</fen> gives the <fen>Theme</fen> to the <fen>Recipient</fen>.
The <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Donor</fen> gives the <fen>Theme</fen> to the <fen>Recipient</fen>.
listRoleExamples: <fex>In my book</fex>, that wasn't very gracious.
Surprising, Dad was stingy <fex>with his inheritance</fex>.
Mr. Burns is extremely miserly <fex>towards his employees</fex>.
It was generous of Jim <fex>to have us over for dinner</fex>.
The Austro-Hungarian Empire had a long history of <fex>military</fex> screw-ups.
It's thrifty of Jo <fex>to re-use teabags</fex>.
